Both damage rolls increase by {@damage 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8} and {@damage 2d8}) and 17th level ({@damage 3d8} and {@damage 3d8}).

spell.name: Prestidigitation
entries: This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

items: You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.
You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.
You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.
You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.
You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Spiny Shield

time.condition: which you take when an attack deals damage to a creature you can touch

entries: An barrier of spikes interposes itself between the target and the attacker. Reduce the damage by {@dice 1d6}. If it was a melee attack, deal piercing damage to the attacker equal to the amount reduced.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the amount reduced by {@dice 1d6} for each additional level.

spell.name: Relay

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature targets you with a ranged effect

entries: You help guide a projectile, spell, or other ranged effect to its true target. Change the target to a creature or object you can see within a number of feet equal to the effect's remaining range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, add 10 to the distance you can choose a new target within for each additional level.

spell.name: Reflect

time.condition: which you take before a creature you can touch is targeted by a spell or is affected by a spell's line area of effect

entries: The opposing caster makes a constitution saving throw. They can choose to fail. Add half the level your casting this spell at rounded up and subtract the level of the spell you're reflecting from your Spell Save DC. On a failure, you reflect the spell. If the spell targeted you, change the target to a creature you can see within the spell's range. If the spell is a line area of effect, change its direction starting at a point on the line you can touch.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special (see description)

Its debatable whether a spell like this should even exist. I'll remove it if it gets out of hand. Its a lot more difficult to pull off than counterspell and only changes one of the targets so I can imagine it actually being worse that counterspell.

spell.name: Find Greater Steed
entries: Removed. If you are granted this spell, learn Find Steed instead.

spell.name: Sickening Radiance
entries: Dim, greenish light spreads within a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The light spreads around corners, and it lasts until the spell ends.

When a creature moves into the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 4d10} radiant damage, and increases its exhaustion by 1. Additionally, it emits a dim, greenish light in a 5-foot radius. This light makes it impossible for the creature to benefit from being {@condition invisible}. The light and any increases to exhaustion caused by this spell go away when the spell ends.

spell.name: Tasha's Mind Whip
entries: You psychically lash out at one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage, and it can't take a reaction until the end of its next turn. Moreover, on its next turn, it must choose whether it gets a move, an action, or a bonus action; it gets only one of the three. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and suffers none of the spell's other effects.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Animate Objects
entries: Objects animate at your command. Choose a number of nonmagical objects within range that aren't being worn or carried, aren't fixed to a surface, and aren't Gargantuan. The maximum number of objects is equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; for this number, a Medium or smaller target counts as one object, a Large target counts as two, and a Huge target counts as three.

Each target animates, sprouts legs, and becomes a Construct that uses the {@creature Animated Object|GaldeveerTanksandFlanks} stat block; this creature is under your control until the spell ends or until it is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Each creature you make with this spell is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, it shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count and takes its turn immediately after yours.

Until the spell ends, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 500 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). If you issue no commands, the creature takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and moves only to avoid harm. When the creature drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it reverts to its object form, and any remaining damage carries over to that form.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The creature's Slam damage increases by {@dice 1d4} - 2 (Medium or smaller), {@dice 1d6} - 1 (Large), or {@dice 1d12} (Huge) for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Bane
entries: Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must each make a Charisma saving throw. Whenever a target that fails this save makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must subtract {@dice 1d4} from the attack roll or save. Do not add it if a negative bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Beast Sense
entries: You touch a Beast that is willing or {@condition charmed} by you. For the duration, you can perceive through the Beast's senses as well as your own. When perceiving through the Beast's senses, you benefit from any special senses it has. If at any point it is neither willing nor {@condition charmed} by you, the spell ends.

spell.name: Bless
entries: You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds {@dice 1d4} to the attack roll or save. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Chill Touch
entries: Channeling the chill of the grave, make a melee spell attack against a target within reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage, and it can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d10}), 11 ({@damage 3d10}), and 17 ({@damage 4d10}).

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Conjure Minor Elementals
entries: You conjure spirits from the Elemental Planes that flit around you in a 15-foot Emanation for the duration. Until the spell ends, any attack you make deals an extra {@damage 2d8} damage when you hit a creature in the Emanation. This damage is Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning (your choice when you make the attack).
In addition, the ground in the Emanation is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for your enemies.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for every 2 spell slot levels above 4.

spell.name: Counterspell

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of yourself casting a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material components

entries: You attempt to interrupt the casting of a spell. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. Add the level your casting this spell at minus the level of the spell you're countering to your Spell Save DC. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If something such as a spell slot was expended to cast the spell, it is not expended.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special (see description above).

spell.name: Crown of Madness
entries: One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the duration. The creature succeeds automatically if it isn't Humanoid.

A spectral crown appears on the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} target's head, and it must use its action before moving on each of its turns to make a melee attack against a creature that you mentally choose. You can only choose itself if there are no other targets within its reach. The target can act normally on its turn if you choose no creature. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.
On your later turns, you must take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to maintain control of the target, or the spell ends.

spell.name: Cause Fear
entries: One creature that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains the {@condition frightened} condition against you for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shroud of Knight
entries: Touch a willing creature you can see. Until the end of your next turn, dim light is darkness while within 5 ft of that creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The duration is extended by one round when you reach levels 5 (2 rounds), 11 (3 rounds) and 17 (4 rounds)

spell.name: Daylight
entries: For the duration, sunlight spreads from a point within range and fills a 60-foot-radius Sphere. The sunlight's area is {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} and sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 60 feet.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the sunlight to fill a 60-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the sunlight.
If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} created by a spell of level 3 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casted at higher levels, increase the level of spell that this spell can dispel by 1 for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Dancing Lights
entries: You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing vague silhouette of yourself. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} in a 10-foot radius.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Find Steed
entries: You summon an otherworldly being that appears as a loyal steed in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The steed resembles a Large, rideable animal of your choice, such as a horse, a camel, a dire wolf, or an elk. If you already have a steed from this spell, the steed is replaced by the new one.

When you prepare this spell, choose the steed's creature type—Celestial, Fey, or Fiend. You can prepare this spell multiple times as long as you pick a different option each time. This creature uses the {@creature Otherworldly Steed|GaldeveerTanksAndFlanks} stat block. When you cast the spell, choose the steed's mythology—Idyllic, Biblical, or Exalted—which determines certain traits in the stat block.
The steed is your ally and obeys all of your commands. See the NPC Allies document for more information.

entries.name: Disappearance of the Steed
entries: The steed disappears if it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or if you die. When it disappears, it leaves behind anything it was wearing or carrying. If you cast this spell again, you decide whether you summon the steed that disappeared or a different one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Find Familiar

m.text: burning incense worth 10+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You gain the service of a familiar, an otherworldly spirit which manifests as a little animal in an unoccupied space you can see within range. This creature uses the {@creature Otherworldly Familiar|GaldeveerTanksAndFlanks} stat block. If you already have a familiar from this spell, the familiar is replaced by the new one.

When you prepare the spell, choose the familiar's creature type: Celestial, Fey, or Fiend. You can prepare this spell multiple times as long as you select a different creature type each time. Whenever you cast the spell, choose the familiar's environment: Air, Land, or Water. The familiar resembles a Tiny animal of your choice—such as an owl, a cat, or a frog—that is native to the chosen environment. Both choices—creature type and environment—determine certain traits in the stat block. The familiar is your ally and obeys all of your commands.

entries.name: Remote Scouting
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can see through the familiar's eyes and hear what it hears while it is within 120 ft of you until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses it has.

entries.name: Disappearance of the familiar
entries: The familiar disappears if it drops to 0 hit points or if you die. When it does, it leaves behind anything it was wearing or carrying. If you cast this spell again, you decide whether you summon the familiar that disappeared or a different one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Eyebite
entries: For the duration, your eyes become an inky void. One creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that you can see must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by one of the following effects of your choice for the duration.

On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to target another creature but can't target a creature again if it has succeeded on a save against this casting of the spell.

entries.name: Asleep
entries: The target has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition. It wakes up if it takes any damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

entries.name: Panicked
entries: The target has the Angered condition. On each of its turns, the Angered target must take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action and move away from you by the safest and shortest route available. If the target moves to a space at least 60 feet away from you where it can't see you, this effect ends.

entries.name: Sickened
entries: The target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for one day. Each time it fails the saving throw, increase it by a day.

spell.name: Conjure Fey
entries: You conjure a Medium spirit from the Feywild in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The spirit lasts for the duration, and it looks like a Fey creature of your choice. When the spirit appears, you can make one melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes Psychic damage equal to {@damage 3d12} plus your spellcasting ability modifier, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} or Angered condition until the start of your next turn, with both you and the spirit as the source of the fear or anger. You can

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your later turns, you can teleport the spirit to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of the space it left and make the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d12|6-9|2d12} for each spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Illusory Dragon
entries: By gathering threads of shadow material from the Shadowfell, you create a Huge shadowy dragon in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The illusion lasts for the spell's duration and occupies its space, as if it were a creature.

When the illusion appears, any of your enemies that can see it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of it for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} creature has disadvantage on attack rolls while the source of its fear is within its line of sight. If a {@condition frightened} creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to the illusion, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the illusion up to 60 feet. At any point during its movement, you can cause it to exhale a blast of energy in a 60-foot cone originating from its space. When you create the dragon, choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, or poison. Each creature in the cone must make an Intelligence saving throw, taking {@damage 7d6} damage of the chosen damage type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The illusion is tangible because of the shadow stuff used to create it, but attacks miss it automatically, it succeeds on all saving throws, and it is immune to all damage and conditions. A creature that uses an action to examine the dragon can determine that it is an illusion by succeeding on an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through it and has advantage on saving throws against its breath.

spell.name: Wrathful Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage from the attack, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Angered condition until the spell ends. At the end of each of its turns, the Angered target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|1-9|1d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Ray of Sickness
entries: You shoot a greenish ray at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} Poison damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. The {@condition poisoned} creature has disadvantage on saving throws to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|1-9|1d8} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Contagion
entries: Your touch inflicts a magical contagion. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 11d8} Necrotic damage and have the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws or ability checks made with the chosen ability.

The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures. If the target succeeds on three of these saves, the spell ends on the target. If the target fails three of the saves, the spell lasts for 7 days on it.

Whenever the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} target receives an effect that would end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition doesn't end on it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The duration doubles for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Detect Chemicals
entries: For the duration, you sense the location of poisons, acids, poisonous or venomous creatures, acidic creatures, oozes and magical contagions within 30 feet of yourself. You sense the kind of poison, acid, creature, or contagion in each case.
The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

spell.name: Dispel Magic
entries: Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. For each ongoing spell on the target make an ability check using your spellcasting ability and add the level you're casting this spell at. The DC is 10 plus the twice opposing spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special (See description)

spell.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: You hurl a beam of crackling energy. Make a ranged spell attack against one creature or object in range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} Force damage. Additionally, until the end of your next turn it treats moving towards you as difficult terrain while your within line of sight.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Malign Missile
entries: You create a glowing dart of necrotic energy which strikes a target you can see within range, dealing {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach warlock levels 5 ({@dice 2d4}), 11 ({@dice 3d4}), and 17 ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Find Traps
entries: You sense any trap within range that is within line of sight. A trap, for the purpose of this spell, includes any object or mechanism that was created to cause damage or other danger. Thus, the spell would sense the {@spell Alarm|XPHB} or {@spell Glyph of Warding|XPHB} spell or a mechanical pit trap, but it wouldn't reveal a natural weakness in the floor, an unstable ceiling, or a hidden sinkhole.
This spell reveals that a trap is present and the direction it is in but not its location. You do learn the general nature of the danger posed by a trap you sense.

spell.name: Enhance Ability
entries: You touch a creature and bestow upon it a magical enhancement. Choose an ability score. For the duration of this spell they add a {@dice d6} to ability checks they make that use that ability score. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2. You can choose a different ability for each target.

spell.name: Entangle
entries: Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the spell ends. At the start of each of the {@condition restrained} creature's turns it can repeat the saving throw, breaking free on a success. A {@condition Restrained|XPHB} creature or a creature it is within reach of can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your spell save DC. On a success, it breaks free.

spell.name: Enthrall
entries: You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that you can see within range to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature you or your companions are fighting automatically succeeds on this save. On a failed save, the target does not notice you casting this spell and has a -10 penalty to Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and Passive {@skill Perception|XPHB} until the spell ends.

spell.name: Fabricate
entries: Select a gathering point of interest. Gathering checks on that point of interest and crafting checks using only materials from that point of interest during the duration of this spell take a 60th as long.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Increase the duration to an hour if you cast this at 5th or higher.

spell.name: Befuddlement

components.m: a key ring with no keys

entries: You blast the mind of a creature that you can see within range. The target makes an Intelligence saving throw.

On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 10d12} Psychic damage and can't cast spells or take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action. At the end of every 30 days, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on a success. The effect can also be ended by the {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB}, {@spell Heal|XPHB}, or {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.
On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

spell.name: Hypnotic Pattern
entries: You create a twisting pattern of colors in a 30-foot Cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who can see the pattern must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the duration. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, the creature has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition and a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 0. At the end of each of its turns the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

spell.name: Identify
entries: You touch an object throughout the spell's casting. If the object is a magic item or some other magical object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB}, any curses placed on it and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any ongoing spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn that spell's name.
If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn which ongoing spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

spell.name: Leomund's Tiny Hut
entries: A 10-foot Emanation springs into existence around you and remains stationary for the duration. The spell fails when you cast it if the Emanation isn't big enough to fully encapsulate all creatures in its area.

Creatures and objects within the Emanation when you cast the spell can move through it freely. All other creatures and objects are barred from passing through it. Spells of level 3 or lower can't be cast through it, and the effects of such spells can't extend into it.

The atmosphere inside the Emanation is comfortable and dry, regardless of the weather outside. Until the spell ends, you can command the interior to have {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} (no action required). The Emanation is opaque from the outside and of any color you choose, but it's transparent from the inside.
The spell ends early if you leave the Emanation or if you cast it again. The dome has an AC of 5 and 60 hit points. A disintegrate spell destroys it instantly.

spell.name: Mage Hand
entries: A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you can see within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast this spell and as an action you can control the hand. If you do, you can move it up to 30 ft and have it perform one object interaction. The hand can hold one object that is 10 pounds or less, cannot exert more than 10 pounds of force, cannot deal damage and has no sense of touch.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Cure Head Wounds
entries: A creature you touch regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d4}. Once within the next minute when they take damage they can reduce the damage by an amount equal to the amount they were healed plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The healing increases by {@scaledice 2d8|1-9|2d4} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Cure Leg Wounds
entries: A creature you touch regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d4}. Once within the next minute they can increase their movement speed by an amount equal to the amount they were healed plus your spellcasting ability modifier until the start of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The healing increases by {@scaledice 2d8|1-9|2d4} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Cure Arm Wounds
entries: A creature you touch regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d4}. Once within the next minute before they hit or miss with a weapon attack they can choose to deal extra damage. On a hit, they deal extra damage of the weapon's damage type equal to the amount they were healed plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The healing increases by {@scaledice 2d8|1-9|2d4} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Mass Cure Head Wounds
entries: A wave of healing energy washes out from a point you can see within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each target regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 5d4}. Once within the next minute when they take damage they can reduce the damage by an amount equal to the amount they were healed plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The healing increases by {@scaledice 5d8|5-9|1d4} for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Mass Cure Arm Wounds
entries: A wave of healing energy washes out from a point you can see within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each target regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 5d4}. Once within the next minute before they hit or miss with a weapon attack they can choose to deal extra damage. On a hit, they deal extra damage of the weapon's damage type equal to the amount they were healed plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The healing increases by {@scaledice 5d8|5-9|1d4} for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Mass Cure Leg Wounds
entries: A wave of healing energy washes out from a point you can see within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each target regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 5d4}. Once within the next minute they can increase their movement speed by an amount equal to the amount they were healed plus your spellcasting ability modifier until the start of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The healing increases by {@scaledice 5d8|5-9|1d4} for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Heat Metal

components.m: a piece of iron and a flame

entries: Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage. The creature can drop the object to avoid taking the damage if they can.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|2-9|1d8} for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Goodberry
entries: Ten berries appear in your hand and are infused with magic for the duration. A creature can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to eat one berry. Eating a berry restores 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.
Uneaten berries disappear when the spell ends.

spell.name: Friends
entries: You magically emanate a sense of friendship toward one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the duration. The target succeeds automatically if it isn't a Humanoid, if you're fighting it, or if you have cast this spell on it within the past 24 hours.

The spell ends early if the target takes damage or if you make an attack roll, deal damage, or force anyone to make a saving throw. When the spell ends, the target knows it was {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Hellish Rebuke

time.condition: which you take in response to a creature you can touch taking damage from a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself

entries: The damager is momentarily surrounded by green flames. It makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d10} Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d10|1-9|1d10} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Mending
entries: This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.
This spell can physically repair a magic item, but it can't restore magic to such an object.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Message
entries: You point toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence; 1 foot of stone, metal, or wood; or a thin sheet of lead blocks the spell.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Minor Illusion
entries: You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

entries.name: Sound
entries: If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

entries.name: Image
entries: If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Misty Step
entries: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher spell levels, increase the distance you teleport by 10 ft for each additional level.

feat.name: Lucky
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
You have inexplicable luck that can kick in at just the right moment, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Luck Points.
items.entry: You have a number of Luck Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus. You regain your expended Luck Points when you finish a Long Rest.

items.name: Good Luck.
items.entry: As a reaction after you fail an attack roll, ability check or saving throw you can spend 1 Luck Point to reroll it, potentially turning it into a success. You must use the new roll.

feat.name: Alert
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
Always on the lookout for danger, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Initiative Proficiency
items.entry: When you roll Initiative, you can add your Proficiency Bonus to the roll.

items.name: Initiative Swap
items.entry: Immediately after you roll Initiative, you can swap your Initiative with the Initiative of one willing ally in the same combat. You can't make this swap if you or the ally is Incapacitated.

feat.name: Healer
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
You have the training and intuition to administer first aid and other care effectively, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Battle Medic
items.entry: If you have a Healer's Kit, you can expend one use of it and tend to a creature within 5 feet of you as an Action. That creature can expend one of its Hit Dice, and you then roll that die. The creature regains a number of Hit Points equal to the roll plus your Proficiency Bonus.

items.name: Healing Rerolls
items.entry: Whenever you roll a die for healing, you can reroll it if it's a 1, and you must use the new roll. This does not apply to hit dice.

feat.name: Savage Attacker
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}

Whenever you hit a target with a Weapon and roll the max number on one of your weapon's damage dice, roll an additional die of that type and add it to the damage. The new die counts as one of your weapon's damage dice.

feat.name: Fighting Initiate
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
You learn the basics of fighting with a weapon:

items.name: Weapon Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in Simple finesse weapons. Additionally, you gain proficiency in one of the following:
simple melee weapons
simple ranged weapons

items.name: Weapon Mastery
items.entry: Gain 2 Masteries. Whenever you gain a level you can swap one of these masteries with a different mastery.

feat.name: Magic Initiate
feat.repeatableNote: Yes, but you must choose a different Spell list each time
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
You have learned the basics of a particular magical tradition. Choose one Spell list. You gain the following benefits related to that choice:

items.name: Two Cantrips
items.entry: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Spell list.

items.name: 1st-level spell
items.entry: Choose one 1st-level Spell from the Spell list. You always have that Spell prepared. You can cast it once without a Spell Slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the Spell using any Spell Slots you have.

entries: Your spellcasting ability for these spells is the spellcasting ability of the spell list's class. Whenever you gain a new level, you can replace one of the Spells you chose for this Feat with a different Spell of the same level from the chosen Spell list.

feat.name: Tavern Brawler
entries: Accustomed to brawling, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Enhanced Unarmed Strike
items.entry: When you hit with your Unarmed Strike and deal damage, you can deal Bludgeoning Damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the normal damage of an Unarmed Strike.

items.name: Damage Rerolls
items.entry: Whenever you roll a damage die for your Unarmed Strike, you can reroll the die if it rolls a 1, and you must use the new roll.

items.name: Shove
items.entry: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an Unarmed Strike, you can deal damage to the target and also push it a number of feet equal to 5 times your Strength modifier.

items.name: Furniture as Weapons
items.entry: You can wield furniture as a Weapon, using the rules of the Greatclub for Small or Medium furniture and the rules of the Club for Tiny furniture.

feat.name: Sentinel
entries: You have mastered techniques to take advantage of every drop in any enemy's guard, gaining the following benefits:

items.name: Guardian
items.entry: Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of you takes the Disengage Action or hits a target other than you with an attack, you can make an Opportunity Attack against that creature.

items.name: Halt
items.entry: When you hit a creature with an Opportunity Attack, their speed becomes 0 until the start of their next turn.

feat.name: Sharpshooter
entries: You can make shots that others find impossible, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Shrapnel
items.entry: When you make an attack with a weapon against a creature that is behind cover and hit, deal extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Firing in Melee
items.entry: Being within reach of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your ranged Attack Rolls with Weapons.

items.name: Long Shots
items.entry: Attacking at Long Range doesn't impose Disadvantage on your ranged Attack Rolls with Weapons.

feat.name: Great Weapon Master
entries: You've learned to use the weight of a weapon to your advantage, letting its momentum empower your strikes. You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Cleave
items.entry: Immediately after you score a Critical Hit with a Melee Weapon or reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points with one, you can make one attack with the same weapon as a Bonus Action.

items.name: Heavy Hits
items.entry: When you hit a creature with a Two-handed Weapon, you can cause the weapon to deal extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus to the target. If you do, you cannot do so again until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Polearm Master
entries: You have trained extensively with pole weapons that have Reach, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Pole Strike
items.entry: Immediately after you take the Attack Action and attack with a Weapon that has the Reach property and the two-handed or versatile property, you can use a Bonus Action to make a Melee Attack with the opposite end of the Weapon. The weapon's damage die for this attack is a d4, and it deals Bludgeoning Damage.

items.name: Reactive Strike
items.entry: While you are holding a Weapon that has the Reach property and the two-handed or versatile property, you can make an attack as a reaction against a creature that enters the Reach you have with that Weapon.

feat.name: Grappler
entries: You're an accomplished wrestler, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Attack Advantage
items.entry: You have Advantage on Attack Rolls against a creature Grappled by you.

items.name: Fast Wrestler
items.entry: Dragging a creature your grappling does not spend your movement, provided the creature is your Size or smaller.

items.name: Punch and Grab
items.entry: Once when you hit a creature with an Unarmed Strike you can deal damage to the target and also grapple it. You regain this ability at the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Heavy Armor Master
entries: You can use your Heavy Armor to deflect strikes, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Damage Reduction
items.entry: When you're hit by an attack with a weapon or unarmed strike while you're wearing Heavy Armor, any Damage dealt to you by that attack is reduced by an amount equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

feat.name: Mind Breaker
entries: You are practiced in breaking the minds of others and guarding your own:

items.name: Shatter Mind
items.entry: If you deal damage to a creature that is concentrating on a spell and they fail the saving throw to maintain concentration by 5 or more, double the damage and the next time you force them to make a saving throw to maintain concentration within the next minute they have disadvantage.

items.name: Guard Mind
items.entry: Before you make an intelligence, charisma or wisdom saving throw, you can choose to add your proficiency bonus to the roll. If you fail, you cannot use this again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Mage Slayer
entries: You have practiced techniques useful in battling magic-users, gaining the following benefits:

items.name: Break Concentration
items.entry: Once per turn before a creature would succeed or fail on a saving throw to maintain concentration that you caused them to make, you can subtract your proficiency bonus from their saving throw.

items.name: Spellguard
items.entry: If someone you can touch would fail a saving throw against a spell, you can add half your level potentially change it into a success. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest or Short Rest.

feat.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: You have developed a bond with your mounts, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Skilled Rider
items.entry: Gain proficiency in a vehicle. If you're already proficient in all vehicles, choose a different tool.

items.name: Mounted Strike
items.entry: While mounted, you have Advantage on Attack Rolls against creatures within 5 feet that are smaller than your mount.

items.name: Leap Aside
items.entry: If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity Saving Throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the Saving Throw, and only half damage if it fails. For your mount to gain this benefit, you must be riding it, and neither of you can be Incapacitated.

items.name: Veer
items.entry: While mounted, you can use your Reaction to force any attacks made by an attacker you can see that hit your mount to hit you instead until the start of their next turn.

feat.name: Ritual Caster
entries: You have studied ritual magic, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Ritual Spells
items.entry: Choose two 1st-level Spells that have the Ritual tag from any spell Lists. You always have those two Spells prepared, and you can cast them with any Spell Slots you have. Choose wisdom, charisma or intelligence as the spellcasting ability when you gain this feat. You can change it when you level up.

items.name: Quick Ritual
items.entry: With this benefit, you can cast a Ritual Spell that you have prepared using its regular casting time, rather than the extended time for a Ritual. Doing so doesn't require a Spell Slot. Once you cast the Spell in this way, you can't use this benefit again until you finish a Long Rest.

feat.name: Ability Innovator
entries: Change one of the primary ability scores of one of your classes or a class you will eventually take. If the ability score is strength or dexterity, then change it to either strength or dexterity. If the ability score is wisdom, intelligence or charisma, change it to either wisdom, intelligence or charisma.

feat.name: Shield Master
entries: You've trained to use shields not just for protection, but also for offense, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Shield Bash
items.entry: Once per turn when you hit a creature within your unarmed reach with a melee weapon, you can make a shove. You must have a Shield equipped to do this.

items.name: Interpose Shield
items.entry: If you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity Saving Throw to take only half damage, you can use your Reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the Saving Throw and are wielding a Shield.

feat.name: Skulker
entries: You are expert at slinking through shadows, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Blindsight
items.entry: You have Blindsight with a range of 10 feet.

items.name: Fog of War
items.entry: Exploiting the distractions of battle, you have Advantage on any Dexterity Check (Stealth) you make as part of the Hide Action during combat.

items.name: Sniper
items.entry: If you make an attack roll and miss while hidden, you are not revealed.

feat.name: Spell Sniper
entries: You have learned techniques to enhance your attacks with certain kinds of spells, gaining the following benefits:

items.name: Shrapnel
items.entry: When you hit a creature that is behind cover with a spell attack, deal extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Casting in Melee
items.entry: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your Attack Rolls with Spells.

items.name: Increased Range
items.entry: When you cast a Spell that has a range of at least 10 feet and that requires you to make an Attack Roll, you can increase the Spell's range by 60 feet.

feat.name: Athlete
entries: You have undergone extensive physical training to gain the following benefits:

items.name: Climb Speed
items.entry: You have a Climb Speed equal to your Speed

items.name: Hop Up
items.entry: When you are Prone, getting up only spends 5ft of movement

items.name: Jumping
items.entry: Once at any time you can add 5 times your proficiency bonus to your jump distance until the start of your next turn. You regain this ability on a short rest or long rest.

feat.name: Charger
entries: You have trained to charge headlong into battle, gaining the following benefits:

items.name: Improved Dash
items.entry: When you take the dash action, your speed increases by 15 ft for that action.

items.name: Charge Attack
items.entry: Once per turn if you move at least 20 feet in a straight line immediately before hitting with an attack, choose one of the following effects: gain a +1d8 bonus to the attack's damage roll, or push the target up to 5 times your strength modifier, provided the target you want to push is no more than one Size larger than you.

feat.name: Crossbow Expert
entries: Thanks to extensive practice with crossbows, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Ignore Loading
items.entry: You ignore the Loading property of crossbows.

items.name: Firing in Melee
items.entry: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your Attack Rolls with crossbows.

items.name: Dual Wielding
items.entry: When you make the extra attack of the Light weapon property, you can add your Ability Modifier to the damage if that attack is with a crossbow.

feat.name: Dual Wielder
entries: You master fighting with two weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items.name: Enhanced Dual Wielding
items.entry: You can treat any weapon you hold in one hand of your choice as a light weapon. You can only change which hand you chose immediately at the start of your turn. This does not apply to weapons you are holding with multiple hands.

items.name: Defensive Offense
items.entry: While holding two light weapons you have +1 AC.

feat.name: Titan Grip
entries: You master fighting with a two-handed weapon in one hand, gaining the following benefits:

items.name: One-Hand Grip
items.entry: Choose one of your hands. Immediately at the start of each of your turns you can change which hand you chose. When you attack with a Versatile or Two-handed weapon that you are holding with only that hand, you can treat the weapon as though you are holding it with two hands.

items.name: Extended Stance
items.entry: Once you can increase the reach of two-handed weapons and versatile weapons you are holding with only the chosen hand by 5ft until the start of your next turn. You regain the ability after a short rest.

feat.name: Durable
entries: Hardy and resilient, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Defy Death
items.entry: You have Advantage on Death Saving Throws.

items.name: Speedy Recovery
items.entry: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one of your Hit Dice, roll the die, and regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll.

items.name: Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

items.name: Expertise
items.entry: Gain expertise in a skill offered by the class that granted you this feat. If you were proficient in that skill, gain proficiency in a skill of your choice.

feat.name: Lightly Armored
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}

items.name: Armor Training
items.entry: Choose four of your class levels. Treat them as if the class they are in grants armor training in light armor. You can change the levels whenever you level up.

items.name: Armor Training
items.entry: Choose four of your class levels. Treat them as if the class they are in grants armor training in shields, heavy armor and light armor. You can change the levels whenever you level up.

feat.name: Heavily Armored
entries: You have trained to use Heavy Armor and shields effectively, gaining the following benefits:

items.name: Armor Training
items.entry: Choose four of your class levels. Treat them as if the class they are in grants armor training in shields, heavy armor and light armor. You can change the levels whenever you level up.

feat.name: Weapon Master
entries: You have practiced extensively with a variety of weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items.name: Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in simple weapons and martial weapons.

feat.name: Crusher
entries: You are practiced in the art of crushing your enemies, granting you the following benefits

items.name: Crush
items.entry: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you.

items.name: Critical
items.entry: When you score a critical hit that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with advantage until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Slasher
entries: You've learned where to cut to have the greatest results, granting you the following benefits.

items.name: Slash
items.entry: Once per turn when you deal slashing damage, you can reduce the speed of the target by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Critical
items.entry: When you score a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the end of your next turn, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.

feat.name: Piercer
entries: You have achieved a penetrating precision in combat, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Pierce
items.entry: Once per turn, when you deal piercing damage, you can re-roll one of the damage dice, and you must use the new roll.

items.name: Critical
items.entry: When you score a critical hit that deals piercing damage to a creature, you can roll one additional damage die when determining the extra piercing damage the target takes.

feat.name: Elemental Adept
feat.repeatableNote: Yes, but you must choose a different element each time
entries: Yes, but you must choose a different Chosen Element option.

items.name: Chosen Element
items.entry: When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.

items.name: Elemental Burst
items.entry: You can use elemental burst at any time. Until the start of your next turn, when you deal damage of the type you chose with a spell and the damage is reduced, you create a burst of elemental damage. If you do, creatures other than you within 5ft of the target must make a dexterity saving throw against your Spell Save DC. On a failure, they take the damage that was prevented. This feature does not affect damage that was dealt by this feature. You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

items.name: Signature Spell
items.entry: Pick a spell you have prepared that deals damage. The damage it deals is changed to the chosen damage type. You can change the spell when you gain a level in a class that granted you this feat.

feat.name: Poisoner
entries: This feat is replaced by the Chemical Adept feat

feat.name: Actor
entries: Skilled at mimicry and dramatics, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Impersation
items.entry: You have advantage on checks for making disguises.

items.name: Mimicry
items.entry: You can perfectly mimic any voice you've listened to for at least a minute.

feat.name: War Caster
entries: Replaced by Great Sage

feat.name: Great Sage
entries: Your mind is fully attuned with your magic, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Deep Concentration
items.entry: Before you take damage while concentrating you can choose to add your proficiency bonus to the saving throw you'll need to make to maintain concentration. If you fail that saving throw, you cannot use this again until you finish a short rest.

items.name: Vast Memory
items.entry: Learn a number of spells equal to your proficiency bonus. They must be spells you can already learn from your spellcasting features. You can replace one of the spells with a different one when you level up.

feat.name: Giant
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}

items.name: Large
items.entry: Your are one size larger and the weight of your body is multiplied by 4

feat.name: Short
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}

items.name: Small
items.entry: You are one size smaller and the weight of your body is divided by 4

items.name: Dart
items.entry: Once when you take the dash action you can increase your movement speed by 10 ft until the start of your next turn. You regain this ability at the start of your next turn.

items.name: Crowded
items.entry: You can occupy the space of other creatures (no more than one at a time).

feat.name: Crafter
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
You are adept at crafting things and bargaining with merchants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Tool Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in an Artisan's Tool of your choice.

items.name: Slapdash
items.entry: When you make a crafting check you can divide the time spent modifier by 2. If you do, you cannot do so again until after a short rest.

items.name: Recycle
items.entry: When you fail a crafting check there is a 10% chance that your materials are not negatively affected.

feat.name: Muscician
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
You are a practiced musician, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Instrument Training
items.entry: You gain proficiency in a Musical Instrument of your choice.

items.name: Inspiring Song
items.entry: As you finish a Long Rest, you can play a song on a Musical Instrument with which you have Tool Proficiency and give Inspiration to allies who hear the song and do not have any inspiration. The number of allies you can affect in this way equals your Proficiency Bonus.

feat.name: Skilled
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
Gain one skill proficiency and one tool proficinecy.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Archery
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Blind Fighting
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
You have blindsight with a range of 10 feet.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Defense
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Dueling
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
When you are wielding a melee weapon that does not have the light property in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}

When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

feat.name: Fighting Style:Interception
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}

Once you can use the reaction of your shield without expending your reaction. It must be a reaction you haven't used this turn and you cannot use it again this turn. You regain this ability after a long rest.

feat.name: Fighting Style:Protection
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}

Choose a reaction that is found on a basic shield when you gain this feat. While holding a shield you can use that reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Superior Technique
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}

You learn one maneuver of your choice from the fighter class. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice.)

You gain one Superiority die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any Superiority dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuvers. A Superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended Superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Thrown Weapon Fighting
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
When you hit with a ranged attack using a thrown weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Unarmed Fighting
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
Your unarmed strikes can deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier on a hit. If you aren't wielding any weapons or a shield when you make the attack roll, the d6 becomes a d8.
At the start of each of your turns, you can deal 1d4 bludgeoning damage to one creature grappled by you.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Cantrip Fighting
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}

Choose a class that has a spell list. Learn 2 cantrips from that class's spell list. Use that class's spellcasting ability as your spellcasting ability for these spells. Whenever you gain a level you can replace one of these cantrips.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Mastered Fighting
entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}
Learn 2 masteries. Whenever you gain a level you can replace one of these masteries.

feat.name: Blind

prerequisite.other: No higher than 1st-level or you're blind

entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}

items.name: Blinded
items.entry: You are blind, but you have 120 ft of tremorsense

items.name: Heighten Senses
items.entry: As a bonus action you can gain advantage on perception checks for one minute. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

items.name: Voice Lock
items.entry: As an action you can force a creature you see to make a charisma saving throw. For the next ten minutes, whenever you're sensing the target with your tremorsense you can hear what it's saying. You regain this ability after a long rest.

feat.name: Amputee
feat.repeatableNote: Yes, but you must choose a different arm each time.

prerequisite.other: No higher than 1st level or you cannot use one of your arms

entries: {@italic 1st-level feat}

items.name: Unusuable Arm
items.entry: You lose the use of one of your arms. It can be an arm that you already cannot use. This might come in the form of a missing arm, missing hand, nerve damaged, etc.

items.name: Presthetique
items.entry: As an action you can attach up to 1 item to the arm you can't use. It counts as holding that item. As an action you can detach it. It cannot be forcibly removed while you're conscious unless you are willing.

items.name: Fancy Feet
items.entry: As a reaction to a creature missing an attack roll against you, you can move up to half your movement speed in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

items.name: Ability Score Increase
items.entry: Increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feat. However, if you're at least level 19, that maximum increases to 22. You can take this feat more than once.

feat.name: Patient Disciple
entries: You've learned to deftly parry attacks, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Clash
items.entry: If you make an attack roll with a versatile weapon against a target immediately when it would hit with an attack roll or would be hit by an attack roll, you can choose to block. If your attack roll is higher than the opposing attack roll, then the opposing attack misses. Additionally, you can choose to make your attack miss the target.

items.name: Patience
items.entry: If you spend your reaction to use a held action, regain your expended reaction.

items.name: Tools
items.entry: Gain proficiency in two tools.

items.name: Ease of Use
items.entry: You can make an ability check with one of these tools without holding it as long as it is on your person.

items.name: Masteries
items.entry: Gain 2 masteries. Whenever you gain a level you can swap one of these masteries with a different mastery.

items.name: Tools
items.entry: Gain proficiency in two tools

items.name: Mechanical Focus
items.entry: You can use those tools as spell focuses

items.name: Two Cantrips
items.entry: Learn two cantrips from a class of your choice. Your spellcasting ability for these cantrips is the spellcasting ability of that class. You can replace these cantrips when you gain a level in the class that granted you this feat.

feat.name: Speedster
entries: You possess exceptional speed and stamina, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Speed Increase
items.entry: Your Speed increases by 10 feet.

items.name: Dash over difficult terrain
items.entry: When you take the Dash Action on your turn, Difficult Terrain doesn't cost you extra movement until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Dual Flurry

prerequisite.other: Extra Attack class feature or equivalent

entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, when you use two-weapon fighting.

feat.name: Opportunity Flurry

prerequisite.other: Extra Attack class feature or equivalent

entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, when you make an opportunity attack.

items.name: Somatic Components
items.entry: You can perform the Somatic Components of a spell with a hand that is holding a shield.

items.name: Protect Concentration
items.entry: If you receive a bonus to your AC from your shield or cover against an effect and that effect causes you to make a saving throw to maintain concentration, add those AC bonuses to the saving throw.

feat.name: Dual Shielder
entries: While holding two shields you have the following features:

items.name: Twin Shield
items.entry: You can benefit from two shields at the same time. While wielding a shield in both hands, decrease the passive ac bonus granted by the shield you're holding in one hand of your choice by 1. You can only change this choice immediately at the start of each of your turns.

items.name: Weaponized Defenses
items.entry: While wielding a shield, you can use 1d6 + your Strength modifier instead of the normal damage of your unarmed strikes and your opportunity attacks can be unarmed strikes even if you don't have an empty hand..

items.name: Dual Don
items.entry: You can don or doff two shields when you normally would don or doff one.

items.name: Relentless Guardian
items.entry: When you use a reaction granted by a shield you can regain your expended reaction. If you do, you cannot do so again until the start of your next turn. It must be a reaction you haven't used this turn and you cannot use it again this turn.

items.name: Interpose Self
items.entry: You can move up 10 ft to get in range to use a reaction granted by a shield. If something prevents you from using the reaction after moving in this way, your reaction is still expended.

items.name: Swap
items.entry: When you would normally draw or stow a weapon, you can instead swap one shield you're holding with another shield on your person.

items.name: Signature Counters
items.entry: Pick four damage types and give each an additional damage type that it can clash with (see miscellaneous document for more information on clashing).

items.name: False Telegraph
items.entry: While holding an action, bonus action or both you can change the trigger and what action and/or bonus action you're holding. The trigger must make it possible for the action or bonus action to clash. You can do this a number of time equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses after a long rest.

items.name: Windstep
items.entry: Once you can jump without a surface to push off of as long as you are held aloft or have a reduced fall speed. You regain this ability at the start of your next turn.

items.name: Feather Fall
items.entry: You know the Feather Fall spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain this ability after a short rest.

items.name: Launch
items.entry: As a reaction to getting pushed or pulled you can double the distance that it pushes or pulls you.

items.name: Bounce
items.entry: When you land after falling you can spend your reaction to jump off of the surface you landed on. The jump's direction must be perpendicular to the surface. During the jump, you can move up to half the distance you fell without spending movement.

items.name: Propel
items.entry: As a bonus action you can double your Fly, Glide or Hover speed until the end of your next turn. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses after a long rest.

items.name: Crash Landing
items.entry: Once as a reaction before you take fall damage you can remove a number of d6s equal to half your level. You regain this ability after a short rest.

feat.name: Mind Over Matter
feat.repeatableNote: Yes, but you must choose the other option for ignore pain

items.name: Ignore Pain
items.entry: Choose one of the following:
Whenever you would make a constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, make a wisdom saving throw instead.
Use wisdom instead of constitution for maximum hit points and rolling hit dice.

items.name: Ignore Death
items.entry: As a bonus action you can ignore all of the negative effects of having zero or less hit points (including death saving throws) for 5 rounds which conclude at the start of your turn. Rounds where you do not spend any movement do not count towards the duration of the effect. You regain this ability after a short rest.

feat.name: Lifesaver
feat.repeatableNote: Yes, but you must choose the other option for miraculous recovery

items.name: Emergency Attention
items.entry: Immediately before you take the help action to attempt to stabilize a creature you can halve the creature's hit points (Rounded down. The hit points must be less than zero). You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

items.name: Miraculous Recovery
items.entry: For every healing die that rolls the highest number it can roll, add a die of that type. This only applies when you are healed or when you heal a creature other than you (choose one). You make this decision when you gain this feat and you can change this decision whenever you gain a feat.

items.name: Hazardous Distraction
items.entry: As a reaction immediately before a creature you can see within a distance equal to a third of your movement speed is affected by a harmful area of effect you can move up to a third of your movement speed straight towards them. If you end your movement in the area of effect, you can make an opportunity attack with a melee weapon against them.

items.name: Avoid Hazard
items.entry: When you take the dodge action you can gain immunity to a damage type of your choice until the start of your next turn. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses after a long rest.

items.name: Run Away
items.entry: When you use the Take Cover reaction you can move three times as far and until the end of the turn you can apply the bonus granted to you by cover to any saving throw you make.

items.name: Keep Safe
items.entry: When you take the dodge action until the start of your next turn creatures other than you within touch range have advantage on dexterity saving throws and attack rolls against them have disadvantage.

items.name: Chosen Chemicals
items.entry: Choose Poison or Acid.

items.name: Modify Chemicals
items.entry: Once at any time you can pick a creature type. Until the start of your next turn, damage you deal of the chosen type to creatures of the type you picked ignores resistance and immunity. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

items.name: Deadly Chemicals
items.entry: Once per turn when you deal damage of the chosen damage type roll an additional damage die for each die that rolled its highest value. It is the same damage type and die type.

items.name: Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in one tool of your choice.

items.name: Expertise
items.entry: Gain expertise in a tool offered by the class that granted you this feat. If you were proficient in that tool, gain proficiency in a tool of your choice.

items.name: 1st-level feat
items.entry: Gain a first level feat.

items.name: Concealed Weapon
items.entry: Attacking with a light weapon does not reveal you from hiding.

items.name: Offhand Punch
items.entry: Once when you make an unarmed strike you can treat it as a light weapon. You regain this ability at the start of your next turn.

items.name: Bleed
items.entry: Once when you hit with a light weapon you can make the target bleed. If you do, they take damage equal to your proficiency bonus at the start of each of their turns until they use their action to stop it. You regain this ability after a long rest.

items.name: Haggle
items.entry: You have advantage on skill checks that are made to haggle a price.

items.name: Hoarder
items.entry: Your carrying capacity is doubled.

items.name: Overuse
items.entry: Once when you spend your bonus action to use a consumable you can regain your expended bonus action. You regain this ability after a short rest.

items.name: Toss
items.entry: Once per turn you can spend an attack to use a consumable that would normally take an action to use. If it's an opportunity attack you must target or center the area of effect on the creature that provoked it. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses after a long rest.

items.name: Fuse
items.entry: As an action you can attach a consumable to a surface. Choose a number of rounds up to a minute, concluding at the end of your turn. It must be a consumable that takes an action to use. When someone steps on the 5ft square of surface it's attached to or the fuse's duration has passed, the item is used. The effect is centered on the space adjacent to the surface it was attached to.

items.name: At the ready
items.entry: You can draw or stow a consumable that takes an action to use when you would normally draw or stow a weapon.
